snippet: The new chief in New York City has promised to end racial discrimination in the department, but it will take more than words to fight the entrenched problem.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Daniel Nigro, New York City's incoming fire commissioner; notes he faces tough challenges in ending 150 years of discrimination at department, which became subject of lawsuit in 2007; calls on Nigro to appoint a strong leader to newly-created post of departmental diversity officer.
lead_paragraph: The new chief in New York City has promised to end racial discrimination in the department, but it will take more than words to fight the entrenched problem.
